name: Protein-Rich Pumpkin Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease with non-stick spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, protein powder, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
In a separate bowl, mix the pumpkin puree, applesauce, maple syrup, and eggs until well combined.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
description: These protein-rich pumpkin muffins are a nutritious and delicious way to start your day or refuel after a workout. They are moist and flavorful with the perfect balance of protein, carbs, and fats to support your active lifestyle.
additional_notes: You can add chopped nuts or dark chocolate chips to the batter for added texture and flavor. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days or freeze for longer storage.
